item.title: VIE 鲍威尔对下一次降息幅度透露甚少
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周一在讲话中表示，美国经济似乎已经做好了通胀持续放缓的准备，这将允许美联储下调基准利率，并 "随着时间的推移 "达到一个不再阻碍经济活动的水平。【原文：The U.S. economy seems poised for a continued slowdown in inflation that will allow the Federal Reserve to cut its benchmark interest rate and "over time" reach a level that is no longer holding back activity, Fed Chair Jerome Powell said on Monday in remarks that showed no obvious lean towards a faster or slower pace of rate reductions.】

item.title: 美国联邦存款保险公司（FDIC）副主席希尔表示，新巴塞尔协议草案仍存在问题
item.description: 美国联邦存款保险公司（Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation）副主席特拉维斯-希尔（Travis Hill）周一在华盛顿的一次活动上表示，"巴塞尔终局 "银行资本增资的新草案仍然存在问题，特别是该规则将如何评估银行的市场风险。【原文：The new draft of the "Basel Endgame" bank capital hikes still has problems, in particular around how the rule would assess banks' market risks, Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Vice Chair Travis Hill said at a Washington event on Monday.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔称利率将 "随着时间推移 "达到中性水平，而非预设路线
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周一在讲话中表示，美国经济似乎已经做好了通胀持续放缓的准备，这将允许美联储下调基准利率，并 "随着时间的推移 "达到一个不再阻碍经济活动的水平。【原文：The U.S. economy seems poised for a continued slowdown in inflation that will allow the Federal Reserve to cut its benchmark interest rate and "over time" reach a level that is no longer holding back activity, Fed Chair Jerome Powell said on Monday in remarks that showed no obvious lean towards a faster or slower pace of rate reductions.】

item.title: 百时美施贵宝击败因抗癌药延期上市而提起的 64 亿美元诉讼
item.description: 布里斯托尔-迈尔斯-施贵宝公司（Bristol Myers Squibb）周一赢得了一项价值 64 亿美元的诉讼的撤诉，该诉讼声称该公司欺骗了前 Celgene 公司的股东，推迟了癌症药物 Breyanzi 和 Celgene 公司开发的另外两种药物获得联邦批准的时间。【原文：Bristol Myers Squibb won the dismissal on Monday of a $6.4 billion lawsuit claiming it cheated former Celgene shareholders by delaying federal approval for the cancer drug Breyanzi and two other drugs developed by Celgene.】

item.title: 易趣驳回美国关于涉嫌销售有害产品的诉讼
item.description: 周一，一名联邦法官驳回了美国政府指控 eBay 违反《清洁空气法》和其他环保法律的诉讼，该诉讼指控 eBay 允许在其平台上销售一些有害产品，其中包括可破坏汽车污染控制装置的设备。【原文：A federal judge on Monday dismissed a U.S. government lawsuit accusing eBay of violating the Clean Air Act and other environmental laws by allowing the sale of several harmful products, including devices that defeat automobile pollution controls, on its platform.】

item.title: 特斯拉季度交付量将上升，因为中国的优惠政策吸引了谨慎的电动汽车买家
item.description: 华尔街预计，特斯拉周三公布的第三季度电动汽车交付量将增长 8%，主要原因是在全球最大的汽车市场--中国，特斯拉延长了优惠政策，并推出了利润丰厚的融资计划。【原文：Tesla is expected to report an 8% jump in third-quarter deliveries of its electric vehicles on Wednesday, Wall Street estimates show, driven by extended incentives and lucrative financing plans in the world's largest auto market, China.】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比重申延长降息路径的理由
item.description: 芝加哥联储主席奥斯汀-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周一重申，鉴于目前的经济状况及其可能的走向，他认为美国央行有理由大范围降息。【原文：Chicago Federal Reserve President Austan Goolsbee reiterated on Monday that he sees a case for extensive U.S. central bank interest rate cuts given the current state of the economy and where it is likely to go.】

item.title: 本季度最后一天，逆回购机制现金激增
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行周一表示，符合条件的企业在其逆回购机制中存放了自 6 月底以来最高水平的现金，此举几乎肯定与本季度的收盘有关。【原文：The Federal Reserve Bank of New York said Monday that eligible firms parked the highest level of cash in its reverse repo facility since late June, in a move almost certainly tied to the close of the quarter.】

item.title: 加州颁布汽车数据隐私法遏制家庭暴力
item.description: 加利福尼亚州州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）签署了一项法案，要求销售联网汽车的汽车制造商采取更多措施保护家庭虐待的幸存者，此举可能会在全国范围内推广此类保障措施。【原文：California Governor Gavin Newsom has signed a bill that requires automakers selling internet-connected cars to do more to protect domestic abuse survivors, a move that may expand such safeguards nationwide.】

item.title: 美国就数据泄露与 T-Mobile 达成 3150 万美元和解协议
item.description: 美国联邦通信委员会（Federal Communications Commission）周一表示，T-Mobile 已同意以 3150 万美元的和解协议解决该委员会对三年来影响数千万美国消费者的重大数据泄露事件的调查。【原文：T-Mobile has agreed to a $31.5 million settlement to resolve a probe by the Federal Communications Commission into significant data breaches over three years that impacted tens of millions of U.S. consumers, the agency said Monday.】

item.title: 俄罗斯计划提高国内生产量，进口汽车将面临更高的费用
item.description: 周一公布的预算文件草案显示，俄罗斯计划从 2025 年起有效提高进口汽车税，将所有汽车生产商必须支付的报废费提高一倍，同时增加国家对国产汽车的支持。【原文：Russia plans to effectively raise taxes on imported cars from 2025 by doubling the scrappage fees all car producers must pay while also increasing state support for locally made vehicles, draft budget documents published on Monday showed.】

item.title: 独家报道如果就业市场疲软，美联储博斯蒂克对再次大幅降息持开放态度
item.description: 亚特兰大联储主席拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）周一表示，如果即将公布的数据显示就业增长放缓的速度快于预期，他将愿意在 11 月份的美国央行会议上再次降息半个百分点。【原文：Atlanta Federal Reserve President Raphael Bostic said on Monday he would be open to another half-percentage-point interest rate cut at the U.S. central bank's meeting in November if upcoming data show job growth slowing faster than expected.】

item.title: 账簿管理人称辉瑞将出售英国 Haleon 公司约 5.9% 的股份
item.description: 一家账簿管理人周一表示，辉瑞打算出售英国消费者保健公司 Haleon 的约 5.4 亿股股份。【原文：Pfizer intends to offload about 540 million shares in the British consumer healthcare company Haleon , a bookrunner said on Monday.】

item.title: EIA 数据显示，7 月份美国石油需求增长至 2019 年以来的最高季节性水平
item.description: 美国能源信息署周一公布的数据显示，7月份美国石油需求上升至2019年以来的最高季节性水平，而产量则在三个月内第二次出现下降。【原文：U.S. oil demand rose in July to the highest seasonal level since 2019 while output declined for the second time in three months, data from the U.S. Energy Information Administration showed on Monday.】

item.title: 纽约州州长表示该州正准备应对港口罢工的影响
item.description: 纽约州州长凯西-霍楚尔（Kathy Hochul）表示，即将于周二早些时候开始的东海岸和墨西哥湾沿岸港口罢工可能会导致严重的交通中断，但她敦促居民不要囤积食物。【原文：New York Governor Kathy Hochul said an impending East Coast and Gulf Coast port strike set to start early Tuesday could result in significant disruptions but urged residents not to stockpile food.】

item.title: Downdetector 显示，美国数千名用户的 Verizon 移动网络瘫痪
item.description: 据故障跟踪网站 Downdetector.com 称，周一 Verizon 通信公司的移动网络在美国有数千名用户出现故障。【原文：Verizon Communications' mobile network was down for thousands of users in the United States on Monday, according to outage tracking website Downdetector.com.】

item.title: 通用汽车自动驾驶部门 Cruise 因泄露车祸信息被罚款 150 万美元
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周一表示，通用汽车公司的自动驾驶汽车部门 Cruise 将支付 150 万美元的罚款，因为该公司未能披露 2023 年 10 月一起涉及行人的严重车祸的细节。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said Monday that General Motors' self-driving car unit Cruise will pay a $1.5 million fine after it failed to disclose details of a serious October 2023 crash involving a pedestrian.】

item.title: 北京放宽购房规定以刺激需求
item.description: 继上海和深圳采取类似举措之后，北京也于周一放宽了购房限制，以刺激需求并支撑陷入困境的房地产市场。【原文：Beijing relaxed restrictions on home buying on Monday, following similar moves by Shanghai and Shenzhen, in a bid to boost demand and prop up the struggling property market.】

item.title: Platinum Equity 旗下英迈公司公开提交美国首次公开募股申请
item.description: 英迈（Ingram Micro）周一公布了其在美国的首次公开募股（IPO）申请，两年多前，这家由私募股权投资支持的电子产品分销商为其重返股市奠定了基础。【原文：Ingram Micro made public its U.S. IPO filing on Monday, more than two years after the private-equity backed electronics distributor laid the foundation for its return to stock markets.】

item.title: FCC 批准无线电执照转让，使 Audacy 得以摆脱破产境地
item.description: 美国联邦通信委员会周一表示，已投票批准转让广播电台执照，以使美国最大的广播和播客公司之一 Audacy 摆脱破产。【原文：The Federal Communications Commission said Monday it had voted to approve the transfer of radio station licenses to allow Audacy, one of the largest radio and podcast companies in the United States, to emerge from bankruptcy.】

item.title: REUTERS IMPACT 联合利华与沃尔玛等达成气候协议，以实现可持续发展目标
item.description: 联合利华首席执行官周一表示，联合利华已与包括沃尔玛在内的十大零售客户达成了可持续发展协议，旨在减少温室气体排放并最大限度地减少供应链中的浪费。【原文：Unilever has agreed sustainability deals with its top 10 retail customers, including Walmart , aimed at cutting greenhouse gas emissions and minimising waste in its supply chain, the consumer giant's CEO said on Monday.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会允许雪佛龙-赫斯交易，禁止约翰-赫斯进入董事会
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会周一允许雪佛龙公司以 530 亿美元收购赫斯公司（Hess Corp），并下令禁止赫斯公司首席执行官约翰-赫斯（John Hess）进入雪佛龙董事会。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission allowed Chevron's $53 billion purchase of Hess Corp on Monday, in an order that barred Hess CEO John Hess from Chevron's board.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 9 月份房价小幅上涨，租金几乎没有增长
item.description: 9 月份，澳大利亚房价涨势不温不火，挂牌量跃升至三年来的新高，拍卖清盘率也有所下降，这表明在通常繁忙的春季开始之际，红火的市场势头已经放缓。【原文：Australia's home prices rose at a tepid pace in September, with a jump in listings to a three-year high and lower auction clearance rates suggesting the momentum in the red-hot market has slowed at the start of the usually busy spring season.】

item.title: TPG 收购财富管理公司 Creative Planning 少数股权
item.description: 资产管理公司 TPG 收购了财富管理公司 Creative Planning 的少数股权，这是该公司在不到一周的时间内达成的第二笔此类交易，目的是扩大其在投资咨询领域的立足点。【原文：Asset manager TPG has bought a minority stake in wealth management firm Creative Planning, striking its second such deal in less than a week as it looks to expand its foothold in the investment advisory space.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，软银将向 OpenAI 投资 5 亿美元
item.description: 据 The Information 周一援引一位熟悉该交易的人士的话报道，日本电信公司软银将向 OpenAI 的最新一轮融资投资 5 亿美元。【原文：Japanese telecom company SoftBank will invest $500 million in OpenAI's latest funding round, The Information reported on Monday, citing a person familiar with the deal.】

item.title: 第三季度市场 "过山车 "式的日元刺激与石油泄漏
item.description: 对市场而言，这是一个多么疯狂的季度！日元创下自 2008 年全球金融危机以来的最强劲表现，各国央行高速旋转，石油跳水，黄金大放异彩，中国大举刺激经济。【原文：What a wild quarter for the markets! The yen's strongest run since the 2008 global crash, central banks swivelling at speed, oil diving, gold shining and China spraying economic stimulus.】

item.title: 嘉年华凭借强劲的邮轮需求和较低的成本上调利润展望
item.description: 嘉年华集团（Carnival Corp）周一第三次上调了年度盈利预期，第三季度业绩超出市场预期，主要得益于游轮度假需求的强劲以及运营成本的降低。【原文：Carnival Corp raised its annual profit forecast for the third time on Monday and beat market expectations for third-quarter results, helped by strength in demand for cruise vacations as well as easing costs of operations.】

item.title: 飓风 "海伦 "导致停电，需求减少，美国天然气价格缓和
item.description: 美国天然气期货周一下跌约 1%，原因是上周末产量略有增加，而且据预测，未来两周的需求将低于此前预期。【原文：U.S. natural gas futures eased about 1% on Monday on a small increase in output over the weekend and forecasts for less demand over the next two weeks than previously expected.】

item.title: 美国制定新规则，可能推动人工智能芯片进入中东地区
item.description: 美国商务部周一发布的一份政府公告称，美国商务部为海外数据中心提供了一项无需个人许可证即可获得人工智能芯片的计划。【原文：The U.S. Commerce Department offered a program on Monday for overseas data centers to get AI chips without individual licenses, according to a government posting.】

item.title: 俄罗斯因违禁内容对谷歌和 Discord 罚款
item.description: 莫斯科法院新闻处称，俄罗斯周一对 Alphabet 旗下的谷歌和即时通讯平台 Discord 处以罚款，原因是它们未能删除或限制访问网上信息。【原文：Russia fined Alphabet's Google and instant messaging platform Discord on Monday for failing to delete or restrict access to information online, the Moscow courts' press service said.】
